programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: The hunt for FREAK SHOW became a thrilling adventure after I spotted him on Cabela’s trail cam. Having hunted Kentucky for over a decade and established my own properties—Bootleggers Ridge and Stonewall Plantation—I was eager for the chance at such a remarkable deer. Despite having drawn a coveted caribou tag through Worldwide Trophy Adventures’ TAGS Program, the allure of FREAK SHOW was too strong to resist. After careful planning and waiting for the right wind, I finally set out on September 11. With my crossbow in hand, I waited anxiously in the stand, my heart racing as the shadows lengthened. Just when I thought the evening might end without a sighting, a movement caught my eye, sending my pulse soaring. With caution, FREAK SHOW appeared.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Continuing on with his quest for The North America Deer Slam, Mark Peterson packs his Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC rifle for a hunt in Mexico targeting the elusive Mexican Texanus Whitetail from elevated blinds. The outfitter here has done an amazing job managing the deer numbers and age groups to grow giant whitetails. Mark is anticipating the pre-rut will get these big bucks moving.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in the final stretch of completing the South America Upland Slam. Having already checked off nine species in Argentina, he now finds himself in Peru, where he faces the challenge of tracking down two elusive species to complete his list: the Andean Tinamou and the Western Peruvian Dove.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he heads to Kentucky for the late muzzleloader season. Already having an unforgettable season so far after taking “Freak Show” back in early September, he is looking to cap off his Kentucky season with a great buck with his Muzzleloader.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It is Mark Peterson’s third day in Mexico hunting for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. After bagging two big bucks in just two days with his new Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC, he is now moving to a new farm where a giant 12-point buck has often been seen in the southeast corner of the property. It’s the coldest day since he arrived, which typically means the deer will be more active. He is thrilled at the prospect of what could be the best day yet. If everything goes well, they will spend the evening hunting hogs from the high rack.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he continues his hunting adventure in the stunning landscapes of Maasai Land, Tanzania. Mark moves to a different camp in this episode to pursue a Gerenuk, known for its long neck and unique browsing habits. He soon after turns his attention to the East African Impala.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP heads to a small tributary off of Lake Ontario to target Spring Steelhead after a major rain fall.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: Week 1 of the Tropic Star Inshore Seminars features guests targeting a plethora of species in the life rich waters surrounding the lodge.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: Week 2 of the Tropic Star Inshore Seminars features guests targeting a plethora of species in the life rich waters surrounding the lodge.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP adapts a BC Salmon Twitchin’ Jig technique to Northern Smallmouth Bass in gin clear waters.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: On a crisp Iowa November morning, everything comes together as Drake Lamb with Midwest Whitetail grunts in a massive 8-point buck that he encountered before with the WoodHaven Midwest Grunter. This is one hunt you don’t want to miss!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stops—getting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Call—to turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After years of chasing one of the oldest and most elusive bucks he's ever encountered, Phillip Vanderpool uses the WoodHaven Initmidator grunt call to finally gets his shot at Tinman, a legendary 10.5-year-old buck in Kansas.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jake Huebschman with The Hunting Public is in Iowa during the rut when he spots a mature buck locked down with a doe. Jake decides to get aggressive, closing the distance and mimicking an intruder buck to trigger a response. Watch as the plan unfolds in real time, showing how bold moves can pay off when hunting pressured whitetails.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: WoodHaven’s Josh Anderson heads to the Western Plains of Kansas in pursuit of a mature whitetail buck. Because of the wide open terrain, a decoy and blind calling can be very affective because of the visibility. After a few well-timed grunts on the Intimidator grunt call, a shooter buck shows up right at the base of the tree!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike and Jacob are hunting an old turkey "Meanie" they have some history with on public land. Mike demos the WoodHaven box call clip.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Danker of Buckventures, returns to his home state of Oklahoma to chase a legendary buck on the Wallahchie Ranch — the "Big 8". With his bow in hand and one specific target in mind, the crew sets up in a blind for what turns into one of the craziest hunts they've ever experienced.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: WoodHaven's Phillip Vanderpool pulls off one of the most incredible hunts of his career — taking down “Cyclops,” a 187” Kansas typical buck! This self-filmed hunt has it all: calling, decoying, and a shot from the ground. Watch as Phillip puts all his skills to the test and brings down one of his biggest bucks ever, completely captured on camera.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike visits Crystal River and fishes with one of his Citrus County friends, Capt JC Livingston, where they battle the good, the bad and the ugly that comes with Tarpon fishing!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to Venice, LA, to explore a unique bayou technique —beach fishing for redfish and black drum in the heart of the Gulf.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Dallas King take advantage of a powerful summer tide, hooking into an all-out redfish frenzy where the action never slows down.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike navigates South Carolina’s breathtaking marsh, seizing a brief window when the seasonal high tide floods the grass, bringing incredible fishing.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA’s skiff gets an upgrade. Now no fish is safe.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: Low country BBQ and Redfish? What more do you want?

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to the scenic Low country of South Carolina for part one of an epic two-part redfish adventure.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: The South Carolina redfish mission continues! C.A. and Stephen hunt for redfish in unfamiliar territory.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss ventures to South Florida with the hope of having a few Exotic Encounters.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Despite adverse conditions, Capt. Jonathan Moss and long time friend, Capt. Adam Whitson, are heading out on the water in search of the Crystal River Inshore Slam.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss is heading offshore into the Gulf of America, eager to feed his offshore fishing obsession.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Central Florida’s St. John’s River is home to countless species of wildlife, making this sweet water estuary the perfect playground for a pair of river rats, Captains Jonathan Moss and Nick Clark.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: In Missouri, we join Avery Epperson on the home farm with one goal in mind—catching up with a legendary buck known as Old Monroe. It doesn’t take long before the hunt heats up as the crew spots their target and works to grunt him into bow range. Hunting over a lush green plot on the home farm, Avery gets the chance every whitetail hunter dreams of.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike is back after em in Alabama and finally finds a tone that this ol gobbler seems to like. Some timely calling and waiting patiently for this longbeard and his hen to make their way to his setup pays off. Back to work Mike, we have calls to make! It's the WoodHaven Way!

programme.title: Team200
programme.desc: Team200 shares their lunar strategies for killing big Whitetails following the moon!

programme.title: Team200
programme.desc: Adam Hays hunts big bucks in Iowa and Illinois

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: Massive wildfires had consumed thousands of acres across the Bighorn Mountains and the neighboring foothills. Would the annual HuntStand pronghorn camp be a total bust, or would the crew be able to find a few animals beyond the smoke?

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: The West Texas desert has a way of pulling you in. In Desert Ghost, Will Cooper heads west to Marathon, Texas, with longtime friend and mentor Cody Roberts to hunt aoudad in one of the most remote landscapes in the state. Rooted in family legacy, this film explores Cody’s deep ties to the desert, the story behind Desert Ghost Distillery, and the mystique of a western oasis near Big Bend National Park. More than a hunt, Desert Ghost dives into the role of aoudad management and its importance to desert bighorn sheep conservation efforts led by Texas Parks and Wildlife and the Wild Sheep Foundation. Sometimes, to protect what belongs here — you have to chase the ghosts. You really do have to be tough, determined, or one lucky bastard to make it out in West Texas.

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: With our annual "turkey tour" canceled due to COVID, Jerry and Austin go "all in" on the PA turkey season. Joining them this week are PFC's Kirk Sherbine and his son, True Form's David "Bunch" Hale, and Sportsman Channel's Rob Freyer. Will they hit the "jackpot" of all turkey seasons? Or lose it all?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Si Robertson and Justin Martin from @DuckCommanderOfficial hunt with Lee Ellis and Kendell Golightly with @seekone8708 during the @realtree Max-7 pro staff Hunt in Louisiana. Lee, on his first duck hunt, is hoping to learn quickly and become the official goose guy of the outdoors while Uncle Si tries not to shoot the decoys!?!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew heads to the timber of Arkansas to hunt with good friends in an old blind that’s seen many unbelievable hunts throughout the years.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: With so much focus on Chronic Wasting Disease, a more deadly disease is all to often being overlooked while it decimates deer herds across the world, that disease is EHD.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: As an avid bird hunter who grew up sharing his passion with his dad, Mark Peterson has traveled the globe pursuing his favorite game. After completing the North America Upland Slam and the New Zealand Wingshooting Slam both in a single season, he’s setting his sights on the South America Upland Slam.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Blake Barnett alongside hunter Jimmy Reynolds as they take part in the 2nd Annual Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. This meaningful whitetail hunt is made possible by the great folks at Disabled Outdoorsmen. Jimmy settles in at the G2 Ranch in South Texas, where prime whitetail country and a shared passion for the outdoors set the stage for an unforgettable hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Behind the Draw
programme.desc: Mike makes a wild stalk on a beautiful velvet mule deer buck. The entire week was a week to remember filled with many ups and downs. We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 1 of this epic Montana bowhunt!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Shawn finally connects with a big Montana Public Land Mule Deer after many incredible stalks throughout the week. This week was one for the books filled with many ups and downs! We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 2 of this epic Montana Bow hunt!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Chandler is kicking season off in KS during the early season and has to get creative to pull it off from the ground! He's familiar with the "Narrow 10" after having a great encounter with him 2 years prior. Closing this story on the Schumacher's farm was a special one with the ground strategy we put together!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Ty’s passion for the outdoors has certainly transcended to the next generation and his kids can’t get enough! Hunter and Alexa both tagged mature bucks with one being a very typical and the other a wild nontypical in this family episode!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The team puts rubber to pavement and heads north to Montana. Tune in as they hit prime Fall fishing with the team at Fins & Feathers and get an inside look at the Adipose Boatworks shop. The excitement doesn’t end there as the team gets challenged by serious mechanical problems with the Fly Shop Tour van and wind up stranded in Montana.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan “Rooster” Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: It disappeared for generations and seasons on end, only to return again. This time, rivaling the golden era of the past. Explore the history of the beginning of sportfishing and how it has influenced the most prestigious anglers in Southern California.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week we are rolling along side the crew from Double T Outfitters. Management plays a huge role in every outfitters success every year. Bret and his team have a strong management plan in place and these guys had a blast with a group of out of state hunters.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair & Capt. Jim Ross team up again to catch some Tarpon off the Space Coast right in front of the rockets. This was the biggest tarpon of the season for sure.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair & Capt. John Beach are at it again, in Crystal River catching some great snook right off the mouth of the river.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair heads down to Islamorada with Capt. Jim Ross aboard the Tunnel Vision Sportfishing Freeman to catch swordfish in the middle of the day.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair stops in Steinhatchee for some Redfish and Trout with Leiza Fitzgerald from CCA Florida.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and his buddy Jeremy set out on a buffalo hunt in the great state of Oklahoma. Along the way they learn about the true past and potential future of the American Buffalo from several interesting people with different perspectives.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree continues to hunt the Arkansas timber working mallards and gadwall.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree teams us with Aurora Skies Outfitting for another Canadian waterfowl hunt. Ducks and geese are diving into the decoys from all directions, and the barrels are heating up fast.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel compares the performance of the High Flyer Series of Kicks choke tubes to help you determine which one is best for your duck hunting scenario.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Crew continues their action-packed waterfowl hunt in Canada as the guys try to pull a few snow geese into the decoys.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: We’re headed to the Midwest for a December waterfowl grind. First stop: Kansas, chasing ducks with the crew from Dirty’s Outerwear. Then Cole Barthel jumps south to Oklahoma to squeeze in one more hunt before Christmas break.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree wraps up their trip to Canada with some of their harvest on the grill. Which tastes better, Sandhill Crane or Speckle Belly?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Drake Waterfowl's Jimbo Ronquest joins the crew in Louisana for the last day of the Realtree Max-7 pro-staff hunt. It is a morning to remember as the ducks fall into the decoys and the guys limit out before 8:00 a.m. on the Mississippi flyway.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Famous for its Mayan ruins, the Yucatan in Mexico is home to a diverse array of wildlife. After years of over-harvesting and exploitation, regulated hunting is helping to conserve large areas of this fragile ecosystem. Dan Cabela travels to the region to find out more.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: South Africa offers an incredible insight into the hunter and gatherer history of ancestors. Dan Cabela re-traces the footsteps of humanity's forefathers and explores how modern, private ownership of land has helped re-balance the human relationship with nature.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: With the fall of the Soviet Union, wildlife populations in Tajikistan were devastated, bringing some of their unique mountain species to the brink of extinction. With the help of funds generated through hunting, vast areas are now being conserved and protected. Dan Cabela explores this conservation success.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Human encroachment and pressure from poaching are the greatest threats to wildlife in Africa. Dan Cabela has traveled to Tanzania to see how Robin Hurt safaris manages two large conservation areas in the face of these daily challenges.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect “locals” day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: The hunt for FREAK SHOW became a thrilling adventure after I spotted him on Cabela’s trail cam. Having hunted Kentucky for over a decade and established my own properties—Bootleggers Ridge and Stonewall Plantation—I was eager for the chance at such a remarkable deer. Despite having drawn a coveted caribou tag through Worldwide Trophy Adventures’ TAGS Program, the allure of FREAK SHOW was too strong to resist. After careful planning and waiting for the right wind, I finally set out on September 11. With my crossbow in hand, I waited anxiously in the stand, my heart racing as the shadows lengthened. Just when I thought the evening might end without a sighting, a movement caught my eye, sending my pulse soaring. With caution, FREAK SHOW appeared.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Continuing on with his quest for The North America Deer Slam, Mark Peterson packs his Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC rifle for a hunt in Mexico targeting the elusive Mexican Texanus Whitetail from elevated blinds. The outfitter here has done an amazing job managing the deer numbers and age groups to grow giant whitetails. Mark is anticipating the pre-rut will get these big bucks moving.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is in the final stretch of completing the South America Upland Slam. Having already checked off nine species in Argentina, he now finds himself in Peru, where he faces the challenge of tracking down two elusive species to complete his list: the Andean Tinamou and the Western Peruvian Dove.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he heads to Kentucky for the late muzzleloader season. Already having an unforgettable season so far after taking “Freak Show” back in early September, he is looking to cap off his Kentucky season with a great buck with his Muzzleloader.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It is Mark Peterson’s third day in Mexico hunting for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. After bagging two big bucks in just two days with his new Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC, he is now moving to a new farm where a giant 12-point buck has often been seen in the southeast corner of the property. It’s the coldest day since he arrived, which typically means the deer will be more active. He is thrilled at the prospect of what could be the best day yet. If everything goes well, they will spend the evening hunting hogs from the high rack.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he continues his hunting adventure in the stunning landscapes of Maasai Land, Tanzania. Mark moves to a different camp in this episode to pursue a Gerenuk, known for its long neck and unique browsing habits. He soon after turns his attention to the East African Impala.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP heads to a small tributary off of Lake Ontario to target Spring Steelhead after a major rain fall.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: Week 1 of the Tropic Star Inshore Seminars features guests targeting a plethora of species in the life rich waters surrounding the lodge.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: Week 2 of the Tropic Star Inshore Seminars features guests targeting a plethora of species in the life rich waters surrounding the lodge.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP adapts a BC Salmon Twitchin’ Jig technique to Northern Smallmouth Bass in gin clear waters.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: On a crisp Iowa November morning, everything comes together as Drake Lamb with Midwest Whitetail grunts in a massive 8-point buck that he encountered before with the WoodHaven Midwest Grunter. This is one hunt you don’t want to miss!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stops—getting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Call—to turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After years of chasing one of the oldest and most elusive bucks he's ever encountered, Phillip Vanderpool uses the WoodHaven Initmidator grunt call to finally gets his shot at Tinman, a legendary 10.5-year-old buck in Kansas.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jake Huebschman with The Hunting Public is in Iowa during the rut when he spots a mature buck locked down with a doe. Jake decides to get aggressive, closing the distance and mimicking an intruder buck to trigger a response. Watch as the plan unfolds in real time, showing how bold moves can pay off when hunting pressured whitetails.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: WoodHaven’s Josh Anderson heads to the Western Plains of Kansas in pursuit of a mature whitetail buck. Because of the wide open terrain, a decoy and blind calling can be very affective because of the visibility. After a few well-timed grunts on the Intimidator grunt call, a shooter buck shows up right at the base of the tree!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike and Jacob are hunting an old turkey "Meanie" they have some history with on public land. Mike demos the WoodHaven box call clip.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Danker of Buckventures, returns to his home state of Oklahoma to chase a legendary buck on the Wallahchie Ranch — the "Big 8". With his bow in hand and one specific target in mind, the crew sets up in a blind for what turns into one of the craziest hunts they've ever experienced.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: WoodHaven's Phillip Vanderpool pulls off one of the most incredible hunts of his career — taking down “Cyclops,” a 187” Kansas typical buck! This self-filmed hunt has it all: calling, decoying, and a shot from the ground. Watch as Phillip puts all his skills to the test and brings down one of his biggest bucks ever, completely captured on camera.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike visits Crystal River and fishes with one of his Citrus County friends, Capt JC Livingston, where they battle the good, the bad and the ugly that comes with Tarpon fishing!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to Venice, LA, to explore a unique bayou technique —beach fishing for redfish and black drum in the heart of the Gulf.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike and Dallas King take advantage of a powerful summer tide, hooking into an all-out redfish frenzy where the action never slows down.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike navigates South Carolina’s breathtaking marsh, seizing a brief window when the seasonal high tide floods the grass, bringing incredible fishing.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA’s skiff gets an upgrade. Now no fish is safe.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: Low country BBQ and Redfish? What more do you want?

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to the scenic Low country of South Carolina for part one of an epic two-part redfish adventure.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: The South Carolina redfish mission continues! C.A. and Stephen hunt for redfish in unfamiliar territory.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss ventures to South Florida with the hope of having a few Exotic Encounters.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Despite adverse conditions, Capt. Jonathan Moss and long time friend, Capt. Adam Whitson, are heading out on the water in search of the Crystal River Inshore Slam.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Capt. Jonathan Moss is heading offshore into the Gulf of America, eager to feed his offshore fishing obsession.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Central Florida’s St. John’s River is home to countless species of wildlife, making this sweet water estuary the perfect playground for a pair of river rats, Captains Jonathan Moss and Nick Clark.

programme.desc: The West Texas desert has a way of pulling you in. In Desert Ghost, Will Cooper heads west to Marathon, Texas, with longtime friend and mentor Cody Roberts to hunt aoudad in one of the most remote landscapes in the state. Rooted in family legacy, this film explores Cody’s deep ties to the desert, the story behind Desert Ghost Distillery, and the mystique of a western oasis near Big Bend National Park. More than a hunt, Desert Ghost dives into the role of aoudad management and its importance to desert bighorn sheep conservation efforts led by Texas Parks and Wildlife and the Wild Sheep Foundation. Sometimes, to protect what belongs here — you have to chase the ghosts. You really do have to be tough, determined, or one lucky bastard to make it out in West Texas.

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: With our annual "turkey tour" canceled due to COVID, Jerry and Austin go "all in" on the PA turkey season. Joining them this week are PFC's Kirk Sherbine and his son, True Form's David "Bunch" Hale, and Sportsman Channel's Rob Freyer. Will they hit the "jackpot" of all turkey seasons? Or lose it all?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Si Robertson and Justin Martin from @DuckCommanderOfficial hunt with Lee Ellis and Kendell Golightly with @seekone8708 during the @realtree Max-7 pro staff Hunt in Louisiana. Lee, on his first duck hunt, is hoping to learn quickly and become the official goose guy of the outdoors while Uncle Si tries not to shoot the decoys!?!

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew heads to the timber of Arkansas to hunt with good friends in an old blind that’s seen many unbelievable hunts throughout the years.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: With so much focus on Chronic Wasting Disease, a more deadly disease is all to often being overlooked while it decimates deer herds across the world, that disease is EHD.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: As an avid bird hunter who grew up sharing his passion with his dad, Mark Peterson has traveled the globe pursuing his favorite game. After completing the North America Upland Slam and the New Zealand Wingshooting Slam both in a single season, he’s setting his sights on the South America Upland Slam.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We join Blake Barnett alongside hunter Jimmy Reynolds as they take part in the 2nd Annual Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. This meaningful whitetail hunt is made possible by the great folks at Disabled Outdoorsmen. Jimmy settles in at the G2 Ranch in South Texas, where prime whitetail country and a shared passion for the outdoors set the stage for an unforgettable hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Behind the Draw
programme.desc: Mike makes a wild stalk on a beautiful velvet mule deer buck. The entire week was a week to remember filled with many ups and downs. We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 1 of this epic Montana bowhunt!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Shawn finally connects with a big Montana Public Land Mule Deer after many incredible stalks throughout the week. This week was one for the books filled with many ups and downs! We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 2 of this epic Montana Bow hunt!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Chandler is kicking season off in KS during the early season and has to get creative to pull it off from the ground! He's familiar with the "Narrow 10" after having a great encounter with him 2 years prior. Closing this story on the Schumacher's farm was a special one with the ground strategy we put together!

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Ty’s passion for the outdoors has certainly transcended to the next generation and his kids can’t get enough! Hunter and Alexa both tagged mature bucks with one being a very typical and the other a wild nontypical in this family episode!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slade’s dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing………. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home décor.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The Flylords team heads to Wyoming for an unforgettable adventure. Join them as they explore incredible fly-fishing opportunities and learn about the passionate folks behind Two Rivers Fishing Co. and Worldcast Anglers. Along the way, they share stories, fish some of Wyoming's best waters, and meet the dedicated guides who call this place home. The team also participates in a special event at Roadhouse Brewing Co., raising money for Jackson Hole Trout Unlimited to help conserve and protect local trout populations.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: The team puts rubber to pavement and heads north to Montana. Tune in as they hit prime Fall fishing with the team at Fins & Feathers and get an inside look at the Adipose Boatworks shop. The excitement doesn’t end there as the team gets challenged by serious mechanical problems with the Fly Shop Tour van and wind up stranded in Montana.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Leaving the van behind the team hits the road and finds themselves in Twin Bridges, Montana where they link up with Dan “Rooster” Leavens of Stonefly Outfitters for some of the best brown trout fishing you can find. The crew wraps up their visit to Montana with a trip to the team at Madison River Fishing Co. and an event to raise funds for the local Trout Unlimited chapter at MAP Brewing.

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: It disappeared for generations and seasons on end, only to return again. This time, rivaling the golden era of the past. Explore the history of the beginning of sportfishing and how it has influenced the most prestigious anglers in Southern California.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they chase Whitetails at Morrow Ranch. This is a hunt that they had purchased earlier at the Disabled Outdoorsman in the year to be able to spend some time in the woods. A few days away to relax and spend quality time with loved ones should always be a priority. Morrow Ranch is definitely a go to place for low fence Texas hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our members. We spent some time in camp with Ron Chandler. Ron Recently renewed his TTHA Membership in 2022 and was awarded a member hunt for 2023. We spend time reflecting on what hunting means to Ron and spending time in camp at G2 with hunters alike.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week we are rolling along side the crew from Double T Outfitters. Management plays a huge role in every outfitters success every year. Bret and his team have a strong management plan in place and these guys had a blast with a group of out of state hunters.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair & Capt. Jim Ross team up again to catch some Tarpon off the Space Coast right in front of the rockets. This was the biggest tarpon of the season for sure.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair & Capt. John Beach are at it again, in Crystal River catching some great snook right off the mouth of the river.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair heads down to Islamorada with Capt. Jim Ross aboard the Tunnel Vision Sportfishing Freeman to catch swordfish in the middle of the day.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair stops in Steinhatchee for some Redfish and Trout with Leiza Fitzgerald from CCA Florida.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and his buddy Jeremy set out on a buffalo hunt in the great state of Oklahoma. Along the way they learn about the true past and potential future of the American Buffalo from several interesting people with different perspectives.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree crew heads north to Alberta for an early jump on the 2025 waterfowl season. Teaming up with Black Jack Outfitters, Cole Barthel joins forces with Rusty Creasey, Dr. Duck, and Billy Campbell for an unforgettable first morning in the dry fields of Canada.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree continues to hunt the Arkansas timber working mallards and gadwall.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree teams us with Aurora Skies Outfitting for another Canadian waterfowl hunt. Ducks and geese are diving into the decoys from all directions, and the barrels are heating up fast.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's Cole Barthel compares the performance of the High Flyer Series of Kicks choke tubes to help you determine which one is best for your duck hunting scenario.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Realtree Crew continues their action-packed waterfowl hunt in Canada as the guys try to pull a few snow geese into the decoys.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: We’re headed to the Midwest for a December waterfowl grind. First stop: Kansas, chasing ducks with the crew from Dirty’s Outerwear. Then Cole Barthel jumps south to Oklahoma to squeeze in one more hunt before Christmas break.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Team Realtree wraps up their trip to Canada with some of their harvest on the grill. Which tastes better, Sandhill Crane or Speckle Belly?

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Timber duck hunts may be the most exciting way to hunt ducks! With strange conditions following the opening of the second split, Cole and the Black Cloud crew struggle to find ducks. Luckily a good friend has a pocket of Timber that is holding birds and invites the guys along for a shoot.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Drake Waterfowl's Jimbo Ronquest joins the crew in Louisana for the last day of the Realtree Max-7 pro-staff hunt. It is a morning to remember as the ducks fall into the decoys and the guys limit out before 8:00 a.m. on the Mississippi flyway.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Famous for its Mayan ruins, the Yucatan in Mexico is home to a diverse array of wildlife. After years of over-harvesting and exploitation, regulated hunting is helping to conserve large areas of this fragile ecosystem. Dan Cabela travels to the region to find out more.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: South Africa offers an incredible insight into the hunter and gatherer history of ancestors. Dan Cabela re-traces the footsteps of humanity's forefathers and explores how modern, private ownership of land has helped re-balance the human relationship with nature.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: With the fall of the Soviet Union, wildlife populations in Tajikistan were devastated, bringing some of their unique mountain species to the brink of extinction. With the help of funds generated through hunting, vast areas are now being conserved and protected. Dan Cabela explores this conservation success.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Human encroachment and pressure from poaching are the greatest threats to wildlife in Africa. Dan Cabela has traveled to Tanzania to see how Robin Hurt safaris manages two large conservation areas in the face of these daily challenges.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect “locals” day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Craig's Wife
programme.desc: A pushy pessimist with an eye for the finer things in life, Harriet (Rosalind Russell) has married Walter Craig (John Boles) because he is able to provide the kind of posh lifestyle she is certain she deserves. She feels not the slightest bit of guilt about her lack of affection for her husband, and aside from John himself, everyone around her seems to realize this. But when her husband gets a scare involving the police, Harriet's way of life is threatened.

programme.title: The Guilt of Janet Ames
programme.desc: War widow Janet Ames (Rosalind Russell) is struck by a car, and later her doctors suspect she may have been attempting suicide. A note in her pocket lists five men whom her husband died saving in battle, and they are contacted to help Janet's recovery. The first man on the list, jaded reporter Smitty Cobb (Melvyn Douglas), is offended when Janet says she hopes to prove her husband died in vain to save five worthless men, and offers to "introduce" Janet to each of the men through hypnotism.

programme.title: The Whole Truth

programme.title: The Bitter Tea of General Yen

programme.title: Pal Joey

programme.title: Our Man in Havana

programme.title: Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River

programme.title: Theodora Goes Wild
programme.desc: Theodora Lynn (Irene Dunne) is secretly the author of a salacious novel written under a pen name. She must hide her identity from the residents of her small, conservative Connecticut town, who disapprove of the book. When Theodora goes to New York to visit her publisher (Thurston Hall), she meets the book's cover artist, Michael Grant (Melvyn Douglas), who tries to convince her to reveal herself as the real author. When Theodora falls for Michael, she soon finds that he has secrets of his own.

programme.title: The Guns of Navarone

programme.title: First Men in the Moon

programme.title: American Madness
programme.desc: During the Depression, the bank owned by generous Dickson (Walter Huston) is barely staying afloat, and things get worse when $100,000 is lifted from the vault. Fingers are pointed at reformed crook Matt (Pat O'Brien), who got a job and a fresh start from Dickson. The innocent Matt can clear his name by admitting that on the night of the robbery he was breaking up a tryst between Dickson's wife and another teller. But this revelation may crush Dickson, and Matt's conscience plays tug-of-war.

programme.title: Salome
programme.desc: Salome tries to save John the Baptist from losing his head to the sword of King Herod, reversing the story that she was responsible for his death.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The long-standing bond between two small-time smugglers sailing around the Caribbean is threatened when a gorgeous siren seeks passage on their boat.

programme.title: You Can't Take It With You
programme.desc: Sweet-natured Alice Sycamore (Jean Arthur) falls for banker's son Tony Kirby (James Stewart). But when she invites her snooty prospective in-laws to dinner to give their blessing to the marriage, Alice's peculiar extended family -- including philosophical grandfather Martin Vanderhof (Lionel Barrymore), hapless fledgling ballerina sister Essie (Ann Miller) and fireworks enthusiast father, Paul (Samuel S. Hinds) -- might be too eccentric for the staid Kirbys.

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: A Tornado in the Saddle
programme.desc: Ranchers and a new sheriff (Russell Hayden) have trouble with a gold rush.

programme.title: Streets of Ghost Town
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his sidekick (Smiley Burnette) look for stolen gold with a history.

programme.title: Secret of Treasure Mountain
programme.desc: An Apache curse hangs over good guys (Valerie French, William Prince) and a villain (Raymond Burr) seeking Spanish gold.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: Gunman's Walk
programme.desc: Rancher Lee Hackett (Van Heflin) spends so much time trying to keep the violent streak of his son Ed (Tab Hunter) in check, he neglects the needs of his other son Davy (James Darren). When Ed's temper results in the death of an innocent Native American, Lee tries his best to cover his son's tracks by making a deal with unscrupulous horse trader Jensen (Ray Teal), who falsely testifies on Ed's behalf. But it becomes clear that Ed can't change, and a shootout between father and son ensues.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail boss’s business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: Lightning Guns
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) investigates the murder of a banker who was about to loan a rancher some money for a controversial dam project.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: The Black Dakotas
programme.desc: A Confederate plot to turn the Sioux against the Union crumbles when a double agent makes off with a shipment of gold.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: Battle of Rogue River
programme.desc: A cavalry major (George Montgomery) makes peace with Indians despite an agitator (Richard Denning) working for carpetbaggers.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: In the Old West, a gunfighting outlaw connives his way into a jail with the goal of stealing a large shipment of gold stored in the prison.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) tries to stop an Army scout and a band of outlaws from starting an American Indian war.

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men
programme.desc: Rancher John Stewart (Randolph Scott) prefers to to resolve problems without falling back on violent solutions. However, fellow cattleman Wick Campbell (Richard Boone) isn't so peaceful, and he hires a team of armed mercenaries, led by ruthless Frank Scavo (Leo Gordon), to rid him of any possible competition. After narrowly surviving an attack from Scavo and his men, Stewart has little choice but to fight back in order to save both his ranch and his family, including nephew Howie (Skip Homeier).

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Last of the Comanches
programme.desc: A cavalry sergeant (Broderick Crawford) leads soldiers, civilians and an Indian (Johnny Stewart) on a desert trek.

programme.title: The Durango Kid
programme.desc: The cowboy hero (Charles Starrett) with a secret saves settlers from rustlers in his movie-series debut.

programme.desc: A couple raising three kids brings two orphaned children into their home.

programme.title: She

programme.title: Bundle of Joy
programme.desc: A shop girl is mistaken for the mother of a foundling.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac, Desi and Russ go under cover during a royal Indian wedding to protect a princess whose policies could put her life in danger; Bozer suspects Riley is up to her old hacking ways.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and the team delve into the world of Italian car culture to track down a crime boss; Mac must lean on Desi when he discovers that he's losing the ability to control his hands; Mac and Desi move in together.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and Desi travel with Bozer to his childhood home when his aunt dies in a tragic accident; they soon discover she may have been murdered for trying to expose the city's contaminated water supply.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and Riley go missing and wake up 24 hours later in a cornfield with no memory of how they got there; they must unravel the mystery and find out how to get rid of the nanotrackers in their bodies, no matter the cost.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Special agents for the Department of External Services, Angus "Mac" MacGyver and Jack Dalton, work to recover a missing bioweapon.

programme.title: MacGyver

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the annual Thassingham Classical Music Festival draws in big audiences, several musicians anxiously compete for the coveted Falconer Bursary Award. programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The double murder of eccentric widow, Isobel Hewitt, and adulterous doctor, Duncan Goff, lead Barnaby and Troy into finding out more about their personal and private lives in the village of Malham Bridge. While Troy suspects an antique dealer that Isobel befriended is the culprit, Barnaby is not convinced, believing anyone the victims knew when they were alive could have been the murderer, from the doctor's wife to the local owner of a restaurant. Even Isobel's close family and members of a local fly fishing group are suspects as they investigate all possible angles.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Martin Wroath is found dead in his home in Midsomer Worthy, Barnaby is unconvinced that he committed suicide with his own shotgun in an unnecessarily complex fashion. When a second murder occurs on an assault course at a local cottage hospital, in which Wroath was a patient, the detective suspects a link between the two murders, and soon finds a wealth of hatred, jealously and lies, before discovering that rope in the village is mysteriously disappearing.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce is taking part in an open-air art class, being held on the village green of Midsomer Florey, when she discovers the body of an elderly fellow student, Ruth Fairfax, concealed beneath some undergrowth shortly after a session. Just as Barnaby begins to learn that Ruth was not all she seemed to be, officers of the NIS pull him off the case. While Troy is allowed to assist them, Barnaby is left handling a local operation into a spate of thefts, yet he decides to continue his investigations in secret. In doing so, he soon turns up armed robbery, unaccounted stolen money, former criminals, and secret liaisons, before discovering that the NIS investigation is not being as thorough as it should be.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: At his family home in Upper Warden, arrogant actor Larry Smith is killed, when a summer house he walks in to as part of a promotion for the sequel to his hit film, The House of Satan, is suddenly destroyed in an explosion. His family quickly fling accusations for his murder directly at the residents of rival village, Lower Warden, leading Barnaby and Troy to determine if this is the case, especially when Larry's director, another member of the family, is electrocuted while using an exercise bike. It's not long before secrets, affairs and blackmail begin to surface from within the two villages.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: While Troy assists an attractive wildlife liaison officer with an investigation into the illegal sale of protected bird eggs, Barnaby travels to Midsomer Magna to investigate the sudden death of a man, who apparently drowned himself. While there was evidence he was desperately seeking to avoid bankruptcy, and had visited a local millionaire to get back his money from a scheme he had invested in, a post mortem reveals that he had been murdered. The two detectives soon find their investigations crossing over, when a man found to have an illegal collection of bird eggs, is also murdered, prompting concerns that the millionaire's scheme is being used to defraud many, and that someone is willing to kill to keep the scheme going.

programme.desc: In the 1980s, metal band Poison were united in their determination to become rock stars. Through hard work and relentless promotion, they did indeed take the world by storm. Their off-stage excess and partying, along with their female following, was legendary. Festering jealousies and power struggles, worsening addictions, gladiatorial backstage fist fights and ultimately burnout from constant touring and partying were amongst the trials they faced.. So which of these ended up poisoning Poison?

programme.desc: Some crews shut down while others struggle to stay afloat after stormy weather arrives with a vengeance; the stalled housing market hits home for the loggers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The news of upcoming layoffs worries the men; Gustafson Logging tries to get back on track; Browning races to meet a big deadline; Pihl Logging is under pressure to finish its Pig Farm job.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard fights the weather while hauling heavy, slick trees on the steepest setting of the season; Danny Pihl and his veteran crew precisely drop 250-foot, old-growth cedars next to a group of cabins.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard races to clear a hillside in time to fill four logging trucks; Jay R Harkness fights to control the untethered Tigercat on a steep, snow-covered mountainside; Bucking Billy and his son Hogan battle a forest of hang-ups and widow-makers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Four companies of loggers risk their lives to chop down timber while dealing with mechanical failures, brutal weather and rugged terrain in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The gap widens between winners and losers at the halfway point of the season; Stump Branch tests a dangerous logging strategy; the Pihl men play while the bosses are away; a mistake by the Gustafson crew may end a man's career.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers barely survive in a plummeting market; the Gustafson bosses have a close call; an old hook-tender returns to the Browning team, halting Jesse's rise to management; Pihl loses a crucial member of the team.

programme.desc: Some loggers have more reasons to be grateful than do others as Thanksgiving arrives; the Pihl crew loses men to illness; the Gustafson crew's younger members blow off steam; the season's first snowfall bodes a warning for the Stump Branch crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Gustafson crew faces a nearly impossible deadline; half the Pihl crew skips work; Stump Branch mistakes and inexperience put profits and lives at risk; Jay Browning makes a troubling discovery about his next job.

programme.desc: The worst storm in 25 years pummels the Oregon coast, turning the town of Veronica into a flooded disaster area; Jay Browning is nowhere to be found; Darrell must act fast to save his house from falling trees.
